lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.DukeTest.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.DukeTest.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

* Creates an ArrayList of duke.task.Task objects to store the List of duke.task.Task.

System.out.println("\t " + "Got it. I've added this task: ");

* Adds an duke.task.Event duke.task.Task to the ArrayList.

* Marks a duke.task.Task as completed in the ArrayList.
* @param lineArray a String array to store the result of a String split
System.out.println("\t Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Marks a duke.task.Task as uncomplete in the ArrayList.
* @param lineArray a String array to store the result of a String split
System.out.println("\t OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Deletes a duke.task.Task in the ArrayList.
* @param lineArray a String array to store the result of a String split
System.out.println("\t Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("\t Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");

assertEquals("[E][ ] event task description (at: Thu, 20 Oct 2022 13:50:59)", eventTask.toString());
assertEquals("[E][X] event task description (at: Thu, 20 Oct 2022 13:50:59)", eventTask.toString());
assertEquals("[E][ ] event task description (at: Thu, 20 Oct 2022 13:50:59)", eventTask.toString());
assertEquals("[T][ ] todo task description", new Todo("todo task description").toString());
assertEquals("[D][ ] deadline task description /by 2022-10-19 13:00:00", new Deadline("deadline task description /by 2022-10-19 13:00:00").toString());
assertEquals("[E][ ] event task description /at 2022-10-20 19:00:00", new Event("event task description /at 2022-10-20 19:00:00").toString());
